channel.title: Common Ground
channel.description: On shared understanding in an age of fragmentation

item.title: Post 0004 — February 22, 2026
item.dc:creator: Common Ground
item.description: Disagreement is part of being human. When strain lasts too long, distance grows.
item.content:encoded:
Disagreement is part of being human.

When strain lasts too long,

distance grows.

Distance makes it easier

to stop seeing one another clearly.

If it lingers,

that distance becomes

the burden we carry.

item.title: Post 0003 — February 15, 2026
item.dc:creator: Common Ground
item.description: When systems stay under strain for too long, people don’t become worse — they become narrower.
item.content:encoded:
When systems stay under strain for too long,

people don’t become worse —

they become narrower.

This narrowing isn’t a failure of character.

It’s a pressure response.

Narrowing changes

how we see.

And how we treat one another.

item.title: Post 0002 — February 8, 2026
item.dc:creator: Common Ground
item.description: You don’t have to agree. You don’t have to choose a side. You don’t have to like everything that follows.
item.content:encoded:
You don’t have to agree.

You don’t have to choose a side.

You don’t have to like

everything that follows.

You just have to stay human

while we figure out what comes next.

item.title: Post 0001 — February 1, 2026
item.dc:creator: Common Ground
item.description: This is not a movement. Not a party. Not a demand for agreement.
item.content:encoded:
This is not a movement.

Not a party.

Not a demand for agreement.

It is a place to stand when the noise gets loud and the ground feels unsteady.

This will move slowly.

On purpose.
